artist: Artist: Itō Shinsui; Publisher: Watanabe Shōzaburō
creditline: Gift of Ellen and Fred Wells
description: portrait (bijin-ga); head and torso of woman wearing blue, yellow and brown plaid kimono with black collar, sewing a pink floral kimono
markings: hand-applied red artist\'s seal: 深水 {Shinsui}; red artist\'s seal: 深水 {Shinsui} | on back, red seal: 貮百五拾枚絶版　第百五拾壹番 {nihyakugojū mai zeppan, dai hyakugojūichi ban} (edition of 250, number 151); red square publisher seal: わたなべ {Watanabe}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The First Collection of Modern Beauties (Gendai bijin shū dai isshū 現代美人集第一輯)
signed: hand written: 此君亭主人 {Shikuntei Shujin}; 深水畫 {Shinsui ga} (picture by Shinsui)
text: Later edition or maybe a gift by Shinsui because of unusual second signature Shikuntei shujin and seal that precede the original. This new seal is used in 1937-40 landscape prints and 1938-39 beauties. In his painting Early Fall (Shoshū) from 1955, Shinsui revisited this subject.
title: Sewing on a Collar
